topic: Book Workflow Series ("Authors comparison explorative search")

goals.1: Identify the BGP for obtaining the books (with publishing date and genre) published by the two authors
goals.2: Did the authors published a book in the same year? What is the longest period without publishing a book for the two authors?
goals.3: Did the authors produced, acted or directed a film? If so, did they write the screenplay?
goals.4: How many films were derived from the books of these two authors?
goals.5: Which author won more literature-related awards? Have they ever being nominated for a Nobel award?

name: 8b86b1b429

1.narrative: Probably he didn't write only notable works
1.query: SELECT distinct ?obj ?name2 ?name ?type WHERE{ ?obj wdt:P50 wd:Q214642 . ?obj wdt:P31 ?type . ?type <http://schema.org/name> ?name . ?obj <http://schema.org/name> ?name2 . }
output: In the Country of Last Things
I Thought My Father Was God
I Thought My Father Was God

1.narrative: Probably he didn't write only notable works
1.query: SELECT distinct ?name ?type WHERE{ ?obj wdt:P50 wd:Q214642 . ?obj wdt:P31 ?type . ?type <http://schema.org/name> ?name . }

1.narrative: Book properties (I use book and written work)
1.query: SELECT distinct ?name ?ret where{ wd:Q214642 wdt:P800 ?obj . ?obj ?x ?book . ?obj ?ret ?z . ?ret <http://schema.org/name> ?name . filter(!regex(?name, "ID")) filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) }

SELECT * where{ {SELECT distinct ?name ?pubdate (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ wd:Q214642 wdt:P800 ?obj . ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . } group by ?name ?pubdate} UNION{ SELECT distinct ?name ?pubdate (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj ?x wd:Q214642 . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . }group by ?name ?pubdate} }
output: In the Country of Last Things
epistolary novel, science fiction novel, dystopian novel

1.query: SELECT distinct ?name ?pubdate ?genres where{ {SELECT distinct ?name ?pubdate (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ wd:Q190379 wdt:P800 ?obj . ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) } group by ?name ?pubdate} UNION{ SELECT distinct ?name ?pubdate (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj ?x wd:Q190379 . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) }group by ?name ?pubdate} UNION {SELECT distinct ?name ?pubdate (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ wd:Q214642 wdt:P800 ?obj . ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) } group by ?name ?pubdate} UNION{ SELECT distinct ?name ?pubdate (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj ?x wd:Q214642 . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) }group by ?name ?pubdate} }order by ?pubdate
output: In the Country of Last Things
epistolary novel, science fiction novel, dystopian novel

2.query: ASK WHERE{ SELECT distinct count(?name) ?sss where{ {SELECT distinct ?name ?sss (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ wd:Q190379 wdt:P800 ?obj . ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) bind (substr(str(?pubdate),1,4) as ?sss) } group by ?name ?sss} UNION{ SELECT distinct ?name ?sss (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj ?x wd:Q190379 . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) bind (substr(str(?pubdate),1,4) as ?sss) }group by ?name ?sss} UNION {SELECT distinct ?name ?sss (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ wd:Q214642 wdt:P800 ?obj . ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) bind (substr(str(?pubdate),1,4) as ?sss) } group by ?name ?sss} UNION{ SELECT distinct ?name ?sss (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj ?x wd:Q214642 . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) bind (substr(str(?pubdate),1,4) as ?sss) }group by ?name ?sss} } group by ?sss having(count(?name)>1) }

2.narrative: Same a s before but without the ask query
2.query: SELECT distinct count(?name) ?sss where{ {SELECT distinct ?name ?sss (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ wd:Q190379 wdt:P800 ?obj . ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) bind (substr(str(?pubdate),1,4) as ?sss) } group by ?name ?sss} UNION{ SELECT distinct ?name ?sss (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj ?x wd:Q190379 . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) bind (substr(str(?pubdate),1,4) as ?sss) }group by ?name ?sss} UNION {SELECT distinct ?name ?sss (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ wd:Q214642 wdt:P800 ?obj . ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) bind (substr(str(?pubdate),1,4) as ?sss) } group by ?name ?sss} UNION{ SELECT distinct ?name ?sss (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj ?x wd:Q214642 . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) bind (substr(str(?pubdate),1,4) as ?sss) }group by ?name ?sss} } group by ?sss having(count(?name)>1) order by ?sss

SELECT distinct ?name ?sss where{ {SELECT distinct ?name ?sss (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ wd:Q214642 wdt:P800 ?obj . ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) bind (substr(str(?pubdate),1,4) as ?sss) } group by ?name ?sss} UNION{ SELECT distinct ?name ?sss (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj ?x wd:Q214642 . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) bind (substr(str(?pubdate),1,4) as ?sss) }group by ?name ?sss} } order by ?sss
output: In the Country of Last Things

2.query: SELECT distinct ?name ?sss where{ {SELECT distinct ?name ?sss (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ wd:Q190379 wdt:P800 ?obj . ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) bind (substr(str(?pubdate),1,4) as ?sss) } group by ?name ?sss} UNION{ SELECT distinct ?name ?sss (group_concat(?genre;separator=", ") as ?genres) where{ ?obj wdt:P31 ?book . ?obj ?x wd:Q190379 . ?obj wdt:P136 ?genre1 . ?obj wdt:P577 ?pubdate . ?obj wdt:P1476 ?name . ?genre1 <http://schema.org/name> ?genre . filter(?book=wd:Q571 ||?book=wd:Q47461344) bind (substr(str(?pubdate),1,4) as ?sss) }group by ?name ?sss} } order by ?sss

3.narrative: Paul Auster notable work (same for Ian McEwan)
They wrote only books (notable) aparently but let's find if the book are related to films. Dead end
3.query: SELECT distinct ?name where{ wd:Q190379 wdt:P800 ?p . ?p ?x ?y . ?x <http://schema.org/name> ?name . filter(!regex(?name, "ID")) }

3.narrative: Maybe they did films that are not related to their books. Going back to the authors properties there is "occupation" and "field of work" that can help
I have to find a way to get the node "film". Writtenwork probably is the instance of a more general "work of art"
Creative work is probably what i need. Check for something about films and movies
3.query: SELECT distinct ?name ?p where{ ?p ?x wd:Q17537576. ?p <http://schema.org/name> ?name . filter(regex(lcase(str(?name)),"film") || regex(lcase(str(?name)),"movie")) }

3.narrative: Something is wrong, properties that exits film
Let's go back to creative work
Let's go back to creative work. Check the properties
Check "instance of" and "subclass". Too many results
In which film Ian Mcewan worked

output: The Inner Life of Martin Frost

3.query: select ?name where{ {SELECT distinct ?name where{ ?x wdt:P161|wdt:P162 wd:Q190379 . ?x wdt:P58 wd:Q190379 . ?x <http://schema.org/name> ?name . } } UNION{ SELECT distinct ?name where{ ?x wdt:P161|wdt:P162 wd:Q214642 . ?x wdt:P58 wd:Q214642 . ?x <http://schema.org/name> ?name . } }}
output: The Inner Life of Martin Frost

4.query: select distinct ?name ?y where{ {SELECT distinct ?name ?y where{ ?x wdt:P161|wdt:P162|wdt:P58 wd:Q214642 . ?x ?y ?z . ?y <http://schema.org/name> ?name . filter(!regex(?name, "ID")) } } UNION{ SELECT distinct ?name ?y where{ ?x wdt:P161|wdt:P162|wdt:P58 wd:Q190379 . ?x ?y ?z . ?y <http://schema.org/name> ?name . filter(!regex(?name, "ID")) } }}
output: original language of film or TV show

4.narrative: Most interesting properties are "based on", "main subject" and "after a work by". Check if they are really useful part 1
4.query: select distinct ?name ?z where{ {SELECT distinct ?name ?z where{ ?x wdt:P161|wdt:P162|wdt:P58 wd:Q214642 . ?x wdt:P1877 ?z . ?z <http://schema.org/name> ?name . filter(!regex(?name, "ID")) } } UNION{ SELECT distinct ?name ?z where{ ?x wdt:P161|wdt:P162|wdt:P58 wd:Q190379 . ?x wdt:P1877 ?z . ?z <http://schema.org/name> ?name . filter(!regex(?name, "ID")) } }}

4.narrative: Most interesting properties are "based on", "main subject" and "after a work by". Check if they are really useful part 2
4.query: select distinct ?name ?z where{ {SELECT distinct ?name ?z where{ ?x wdt:P161|wdt:P162|wdt:P58 wd:Q214642 . ?x wdt:P921 ?z . ?z <http://schema.org/name> ?name . filter(!regex(?name, "ID")) } } UNION{ SELECT distinct ?name ?z where{ ?x wdt:P161|wdt:P162|wdt:P58 wd:Q190379 . ?x wdt:P921 ?z . ?z <http://schema.org/name> ?name . filter(!regex(?name, "ID")) } }}

4.narrative: This should be the answer to 4 but maybe they didn't work on the film based on their book so let's check that
4.query: select ?paulcount ?iancount where{ {SELECT count(distinct ?name) as ?paulcount where{ ?x wdt:P161|wdt:P162|wdt:P58 wd:Q214642 . ?x wdt:P144 ?z . ?z <http://schema.org/name> ?name . } } { SELECT count(distinct ?name) as ?iancount where{ ?x wdt:P161|wdt:P162|wdt:P58 wd:Q190379 . ?x wdt:P144 ?z . ?z <http://schema.org/name> ?name . } }}
select distinct ?name ?p where{ ?x wdt:P161|wdt:P162|wdt:P58 wd:Q190379 . ?x wdt:P31 ?p . ?p <http://schema.org/name> ?name . }

4.narrative: Check that the "based on" property points to the right thing
4.query: select ?name1 ?name2 where{ ?x wdt:P161|wdt:P162|wdt:P58 wd:Q190379 . ?x wdt:P144 ?z . wd:Q190379 ?w ?z . ?w <http://schema.org/name> ?name1 . ?z <http://schema.org/name> ?name2 . }

4.narrative: I have also to specify that I'm talking about films
4.query: select ?paulcount ?iancount where{ {SELECT count(distinct ?name) as ?paulcount where{ ?x wdt:P31 wd:Q11424 . ?x wdt:P144 ?z . wd:Q214642 wdt:P800 ?z. ?x <http://schema.org/name> ?name . } } { SELECT count(distinct ?name) as ?iancount where{ ?x wdt:P31 wd:Q11424 . ?x wdt:P144 ?z . wd:Q190379 wdt:P800 ?z . ?x <http://schema.org/name> ?name . } }}

4.narrative: Film on which they worked in general
4.query: select ?paulcount ?iancount where{ {SELECT count(distinct ?name) as ?paulcount where{ ?x wdt:P31 wd:Q11424 . ?x wdt:P161|wdt:P162|wdt:P58 wd:Q214642 . ?x <http://schema.org/name> ?name . } } { SELECT count(distinct ?name) as ?iancount where{ ?x wdt:P31 wd:Q11424 . ?x wdt:P161|wdt:P162|wdt:P58 wd:Q190379 . ?x <http://schema.org/name> ?name . } }}

output: on focus list of Wikimedia project
category for recipients of this award

5.narrative: Checked some properties, what i need is as always instance of
5.query: SELECT distinct ?y ?name WHERE { wd:Q190379 wdt:P166 ?award . ?award wdt:P31 ?y . ?y <http://schema.org/name> ?name . filter(!regex(?name,"ID")) }

select ?paulcount ?iancount where{ {SELECT count(distinct ?name) as ?paulcount where{ wd:Q214642 wdt:P166 ?award . ?award wdt:P31 wd:Q378427 . ?award <http://schema.org/name> ?name . } } { SELECT count(distinct ?name) as ?iancount where{ wd:Q190379 wdt:P166 ?award . ?award wdt:P31 wd:Q378427 . ?award <http://schema.org/name> ?name . } }}

5.narrative: There is nothing about nomination for prizes so let's start from the Nobel
I assume that the nominated are linked to the nobel and not the other way around

5.query: ask where { ?y wdt:P1411 wd:Q37922 . filter(?y= wd:Q190379 || ?y= wd:Q214642 ) }
